cheatsheet.title: Visualising Scientific Data on Local Machine

intro.description: This cheat sheet will show you how to invoke a locally rendered visualisation.

item.title: Open the g-Eclipse User perspective
item.description: If you are not already in the g-Eclipse User perspective, in the main menu select Window > Open Perspective > Other... and select g-Eclipse (User). Alternatively, click on the "Click to Perform" link below.

item.title: Locate a VTK Pipeline File
item.description: If you have followed the previous cheatsheets, you will have a .vtkpipeline file somewhere in your project view. Locate this file.

item.title: Open Local Rendering Viewer
item.description: Right-click on your .vtkpipeline file and select Render Locally. This will bring up a Visualisation viewer. After a few seconds, you will see your data rendered in the view.

item.title: Interact with Rendered Image
item.description: You can explore your data by dragging the mouse. Right-click to zoom, left-click to rotate and middle button to move the image.
